adrs.title: Dual Engine Architecture (Stateful + Stateless)
adrs.summary: YAWL maintains both a stateful YEngine (persistent, long-running) and a stateless YStatelessEngine (ephemeral, serverless) sharing a common YNetRunner execution core.

adrs.title: Singleton vs Instance-based YEngine
adrs.summary: YEngine.getInstance() singleton is retained for backward compatibility but deprecated; v6.0 clustering requires instance-based injection.

adrs.title: Maven Primary, Ant Deprecated
adrs.summary: Maven is the primary build system. Ant build scripts are deprecated and will be removed in 2027.

adrs.title: Spring Boot 3.4 + Java 25
adrs.summary: YAWL targets Java 25 (preview features enabled) and Spring Boot 3.4+ as the baseline platform for v5.2 and v6.0.

adrs.title: SPIFFE/SPIRE for Zero-Trust Identity
adrs.summary: Service-to-service authentication uses SPIFFE/SPIRE workload identity certificates. Complements JWT-based human authentication (ADR-017).

adrs.title: OpenTelemetry for Observability
adrs.summary: YAWL uses OpenTelemetry SDK for distributed tracing, metrics, and structured logging with OTLP export.

adrs.title: Repository Pattern for Caching
adrs.summary: The Repository pattern wraps Hibernate queries with Caffeine in-process cache for frequently read, infrequently changed data (specifications, task definitions).

adrs.title: Resilience4j for Circuit Breaking
adrs.summary: Resilience4j provides circuit breakers, retry logic, and rate limiters for all external service calls (database, resource service, external APIs).

adrs.title: Multi-Cloud Strategy (GCP/AWS/Azure/Oracle)
adrs.summary: YAWL is deployed to all four major cloud platforms using cloud-agnostic Kubernetes manifests and Helm charts.

adrs.title: Virtual Threads for Scalability
adrs.summary: Java 25 virtual threads (Project Loom) replace platform thread pools for all I/O-bound engine operations, enabling high-concurrency without thread pool sizing.

adrs.title: Jakarta EE 10 Migration Strategy
adrs.summary: Migration of all javax.* imports to jakarta.* namespace for Jakarta EE 10 compatibility (Spring Boot 3.x, Tomcat 10+, WildFly 27+).

adrs.title: A2A Server Authentication Architecture
adrs.summary: Authentication architecture for the YAWL A2A (Agent-to-Agent) server, defining how autonomous agents authenticate when participating in YAWL workflows.

adrs.title: YAWL Schema Versioning Strategy for v6.0.0
adrs.summary: YAWL specification schemas use semantic versioning. YAWL_Schema6.0.xsd is the v6 baseline. XSLT transforms upgrade v4/v5 specs. New v6 features (agentBinding, executionProfile) are optional elements.

adrs.title: Clustering and Horizontal Scaling Architecture
adrs.summary: Shared-database clustering with Redis distributed leases for case ownership. Active-active engine nodes. JWT sessions require no sticky sessions. Planned for v6.1.0.

adrs.title: Persistence Layer Architecture for v6.0.0
adrs.summary: HikariCP connection pooling, Flyway schema migrations, Hibernate Envers audit trail, schema-based multi-tenancy, and read/write query routing to replica.

adrs.title: API Changelog and Deprecation Policy
adrs.summary: 12-month minimum deprecation notice before breaking changes. Deprecated endpoints return RFC 8594 Deprecation/Sunset headers. docs/api/CHANGELOG.md is the versioned record.

adrs.title: Authentication and Session Management for v6.0.0
adrs.summary: Session handles are HMAC-SHA256 signed JWTs replacing v5.x opaque blobs. Stateless validation enables clustering. Role-based access control (RBAC) enforced per endpoint.

adrs.title: JavaDoc-to-OpenAPI Documentation Generation
adrs.summary: Two-track documentation: OpenAPI YAML drives API docs (Swagger UI, ReDoc, client SDK). A Javadoc quality gate enforces @param/@return/@throws on all public methods.

adrs.title: Autonomous Agent Framework Architecture
adrs.summary: Plugin-based agent framework with four strategy interfaces (Discovery, Eligibility, Decision, Output). Agents participate in workflows via standard Interface B. MCP and A2A bridges provided.

adrs.title: Workflow Pattern Library Architecture
adrs.summary: Versioned pattern library with 20 documented templates (9 WCP control-flow, 8 enterprise, 3 agent patterns). Registry JSON enables search API and IDE integration.

adrs.title: Automatic Engine Selection for v6.0.0
adrs.summary: Specifications declare <executionProfile> to hint preferred engine. EngineSelector routes case launches to stateful or stateless engine based on workflow characteristics.

adrs.title: OpenAPI-First API Design for v6.0.0
adrs.summary: The canonical YAWL REST API contract is docs/api/openapi-v6.yaml (OpenAPI 3.1.0). All client SDK generation, documentation, and validation derive from this file.
